Thanks for the explanation.  I'll probably stick with 1.x for now
then.  Wi=
ll Processors/Extractor written for 1.x be compatible with
2.0?  Or will ma=
jor work be needed to make them work under 2.0?  

Thanks again!
Andrew

--=
- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> P=
aul is right.
> 
> To further explain what "not entirely functional" means,=
 in the branch 
> (1) customizing jobs requires manually editing configurat=
ion files in a 
> new format; (2) most 1.X web UI features are not yet port=
ed, though 
> there is more you can do via JMX; (3) there are various 'loos=
e ends' of 
> incomplete functionality to be completed. Thus it's still for=
 
> adventurous developers curious about the crawler internals.
> 
> As soo=
n as the branch web UI reaches rough parity with the web UI of 
> 1.X, so t=
hat expert users who can run from SVN snapshots/auto-builds 
> would be com=
fortable exploring, the branch will be merged back into the 
> SVN trunk.
>=
 
> When the changes are stable enough for our standard suite of crawls, it=
 
> will become a 2.0.0 candidate release and then official release. Even 
=
> then, those running regular crawls, and familiar with the old Heritrix, 
=
> may choose to linger on 1.12.1 for a while, rather than immediately 
> ta=
king the adjustment hit. Major new functionality in frontier 
> configurati=
on and control is planned for 2.2 about 2 months after 2.0.
> 
> So:
> - 1.=
12.1 is the latest-and-greatest official release
> - SVN trunk is still 1.1=
2.1-based
> - 2.0.0 work is underway in the 'pjack_settings' branch, but wo=
uld be a 
> challenging way to get started with Heritrix until this work co=
mes back 
> into trunk
> 
> Hope this helps you make the right choice for y=
our interests,
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> Paul Jack wrote:
> > Heritrix 2.0 de=
velopment is proceeding in the svn branch  
> > pjack_settings. It started =
as an experimental branch before we  
> > decided to make that branch 2.0.
=
> > 
> > The pjack_settings branch will be moved to trunk in a matter of  
=
> > weeks. Until then, the branch should be stable, but not entirely  
> > =
functional. The pjack_settings branch does build using maven 2.0.
> > 
> > =
-Paul
